intro: Asperula hercegovina, commonly known as the Hercegovaian woodruff, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Asperula hercegovina is often found in woodlands and rocky soils, thriving in partial shade.
